description.narrative: The main objective of the project is to strengthen the country's capacity to assess seismic risks, as well as to prevent and respond to potential earthquakes and associated cascading emergencies.

1.1. Number of methodological recommendations and proposals for approbation of some modern methods of seismic microzoning and assessment of vulnerability of buildings 1.2 Number of developed seismic maps of different levels of zoning and directionality (updated) for the city of Ashgabat
1.3 Number of geospatial models of earthquake susceptibility to buildings in target areas (housing stock and administrative buildings) based on building and ground characteristics 2.1 Number of laboratories of the Institute of seismology equipped with necessary and updated scientific and technical equipment
2.2. Number of employees of scientific research institutes, ministries and departments that have passed trainings and courses on modern methods of seismic risk assessment 2.3 Number of scientific and methodological and practical bases developed to improve the principles of existing disaster preparedness, complex monitoring and reporting of seismic events 3.1 Number of developed scenarios for the emergencies and development of disasters in case of the impact of strong earthquakes in targeted settlements on an improved scientific and methodological basis, using the example of a spatially linked scenario for the development of consequences for different time intervals 3.2 Number of training methods and materials for assessing the risks of earthquakes, associated risks of secondary and cascade disasters replicated and sent to local executive bodies for further use 3.3. Number of recommendations to the Ministry of Education on the inclusion of modules to assess seismic hazard and risk in the educational process of pilot universities for the further involvement of junior personnel in scientific activities. 3.4 Number of investment strategies for DRR at the macro level

comment.narrative:
1.Last version of seismic microzoning of Ashgabat city (scale 1:25000) was approved in 2001. 2.Until now, the Institute of seismology was not dealing with issues of seismic risk assessment
3.? Relations with international organizations on the matter of seismic risk assessment are limited: the Institute of seismology, as well as the relevant Office of the Ministry of Defense, are not sufficiently involved in international practice.
Due to different objective reasons, project started its operations around September 2018 and most of the targeted results will be achieved in 2019 and subsequent years of the project

1.1. Number of methodological recommendations and proposals for approbation of some modern methods of seismic microzoning and assessment of vulnerability of buildings - 2 1.2 Number of developed seismic maps of different levels of zoning and directionality (updated) for the city of Ashgabat - 2
2.1 Number of laboratories of the Institute of seismology equipped with necessary and updated scientific and technical equipment - 2 2.2. Number of employees of scientific research institutes, ministries and departments that have passed trainings and courses on modern methods of seismic risk assessment - 30 psns

1.1. Conducted analysis of existing seismic zoning maps (general, detailed, microzoning). The process of certification of buildings and assessment of their vulnerability was started and will continue in 2020. 1.2. The process of developing seismic maps is slightly delayed due to the long process of receiving data from Ministry of Defense. The process started at the end 2019 and will continue in 2020.
2.1. Part of the necessary technical equipment was procured and delivered for Institute of seismology. Procurement of more technical equipment was contracted and will be delivered early 2020. 2.2. Three trainings were conducted (including introductory and advanced courses) on teaching geographical information systems (GIS) and their application. 25 employees of scientific research institutes, ministries and departments attended the training.

1.1. The number of methods in various disciplines to fulfil the targets for the project – 3. 1.2. The number of types of practical work in various disciplines aimed at obtaining new information geological-geophysical, engineering-geological nature, as well as systematic data on the technical condition of buildings and structures - 2.
1.3. The number of updated maps tectonic and seismological direction for the city of Ashgabat - 2. 1.4. A number of studies and regional assessments of seismic vulnerability of buildings are representative of categories - 1.
2.1. The number of laboratories of the Institute of seismology and atmospheric physics, Academy of Sciences of Turkmenistan, equipped with modern scientific and technical equipment - 3. 2.2. The number of employees of scientific research institutes, ministries and departments, held training courses on modern approaches and techniques in the field of seismic risk - 20. 2.3. The number of scientific-methodological AIDS for training of personnel of research institutes at national level - 2.

1.1. A critical analysis of modern techniques is performed: a) mapping of active tectonic faults; b) seismic micro-zoning; C) seismic risk assessment. Based on the analysis, methodological recommendations for their use were prepared. 1.2. 4 stages of certification of buildings in Ashgabat were completed with the preparation of a single passport. Due to the long delay in financing the project, the 5th stage of certification, as well as preparatory geological and geophysical work to determine the velocities of transverse waves and complex measurements and observations to obtain data on the resonant frequency characteristics of soils, were postponed to 2021.
1.3. For the same reason, the mapping of active tectonic faults and the seismic micro-zoning map has been postponed to 2021. 1.4. Due to the long delay in financing the project, work has been partially carried out to determine the seismic vulnerability of each of the representative categories of buildings in Ashgabat. The work will continue and should be completed in 2021.
2.1. Modern equipment is supplied for 3 laboratories of the Institute of seismology and atmospheric physics of the Academy of Sciences of Turkmenistan. 2.2. In connection with the situation caused by the COVID-19 the conduct of training course on the assessment of vulnerability of buildings is also postponed to 2021 2.3. All documents were prepared, a competition was held and a national Consultant was selected to compile a Russian-Turkmen and English-Turkmen explanatory dictionary on Geology, Geophysics, seismology, seismic hazard, seismic vulnerability and seismic risk. But due to lack of funding, the contract with the National Consultant was not concluded.

1.1 There is the quantity of procedures of a various area of expertise for performance of target tasks under the project. -3 1.2 There is the quantity of types of practical works of the various area of expertise, directed to receiving of a new information of geological-geophysical, engineering-geological character, as well as the systematized data about a technical condition of buildings and constructions. - 2
1.3 There is the quantity of the updated maps of a tectonic and seismological orientation for the territory of Ashgabat city. - 2 1.4 There is the quantity of researches and territorial assessments of seismic vulnerability of buildings of representative categories. - 1
2.1 There is the quantity of laboratories in the Institute of seismology and physics of the atmosphere of the Academy of science of Turkmenistan, were equipped by the modern scientific and technical equipment. - 3 2.2 There is the number of employees of scientific research institutes, the ministries and the authorities which have been trained under modern approaches and procedures in the field of seismic risk. – 20 2.3 There is the quantity of scientifically-methodical manuals for training personnel of scientific research institutes at a national level. - 2

1.1 The critical analysis of modern procedures was executed: a) mapping of active tectonic breaks; b) seismic microzoning; c) assessments of seismic risk. On the basis of the lead analysis of methodical recommendations on their appliance was prepared. -
1.2. Four stages of buildings certification in Ashgabat with preparation of the passport of the uniform sample were executed. In connection with a long delay in financing the project the 5-th stage of certification, as well as carrying out of preparatory geological-geophysical works on definition of speeds of cross-section waves and complex measurements and supervision for data acquisition about resonant-frequency characteristics of soils, were transferred on 2021.
1.3. For the same reason preparation of a map of active tectonic breaks and maps of seismic microzoning were transferred on 2021. 1.4. In connection with a delay in financing the project were partially performed works on definition of seismic vulnerability of each of representative categories of buildings of Ashgabat. Works will be continued and should be completed in 2021. 2.1. The modern equipment was supplied to three laboratories in the Institute of seismology and physics of the atmosphere of the Academy of science of Turkmenistan. 2.2. In connection with a situation caused COVID-19 carrying out the training course on vulnerability of buildings also was transferred on 2021. 2.3. All documents have been prepared, the competition was led and the National Consultant for preparation of a Russian-Turkmen and English-Turkmen explanatory dictionary on geology, geophysics, seismology, seismic danger, seismic vulnerability and seismic risk was selected. But in connection with absence of financing the contract with the National Consultant had not been concluded.
